Hosting, CMS & Domain Names

Cloudcannon

Hosting with CloudCannon

We’re going to explore two options here, Netlify and CloudCannon.

Getting Your Site Online with CloudCannon

CloudCannon is a great option if you need to be able to provide a non-tenchnical person the ability to edit their site. Plans start at $25 per month, for unlimited websites so if you just want to host your personal portfolio it might be overkill but if you are building client sites and can then charge them for hosting (I would recommend around $15 per month just for hosting & CMS, or $45 per month including basic changes and technical support) and it’s brilliantly easy to set up compared to something like wordpress.

  1. Go to www.cloudcannon.com and sign up for an account (everyone has access to a 30 day free trial)
  2. Click on ‘Add New Site’ and give your site a name
  3. In the top right-hand corner click on upload. If you are using firefox or chrome, you can upload the whole folder that contains your website in one go.
  4. As soon as the files have uploaded, your site is now live and hosted on the internet! You can check it out on the temporary domain that you’ll see in the top left-hand corner.

CloudCannon has provided us with a 3 month free coupon for our students, which is iocfree.

Making the site editable for your client

To make the site editable, in the HTML just add the class ‘editable’ to anything you want them to be able to edit. If you add it to a container element like a div or a section they will have more flexibilty (ie add headings, paragraphs, links, etc) but it means they could also break the layout. If you add the class to a paragraph, heading or image they can only change the content of that element itself.

I usually use a mix of methods – for pages with big content sections where they want more control, I make the section editable, and for the home page or any parts where I think they might break the layout, I use it on the element itself.

Next you just need to go into CloudCannon settings and set up client sharing by creating a password for them to login with.
